item.title: Academic
item.description: The highly flexible website framework for Hugo with an extensible plugin mechanism. Create a beautifully simple site in under 10 minutes ðŸš€ Latest release (function defer() { if (window.jQuery) { jQuery(document).ready(function(){ GetLatestReleaseInfo(); }); } else { setTimeout(function() { defer() }, 50); } })(); function GetLatestReleaseInfo() { $.getJSON('https://api.github.com/repos/gcushen/hugo-academic/tags').done(function (json) { let release = json[0]; // let downloadURL = release.zipball_url; $('#academic-release').text('Latest release ' + release.name); }); }

Biography I am a Bioinformatics Scientist in the Young Laboratory at the Whitehead Institute for Biomedical Research. My research interests include the role of nuclear organization in gene expression and mechanisms of transcriptional dysregulation in cancer. I earned my Ph.D. at the NYU School of Medicine, under the supervision of Drs. Iannis Aifantis and Aristotelis Tsirigos. During my Ph.D. research, I focused on genetic alterations of topologically associating domain (TAD) boundaries and their link with aberrant oncogene activation in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Training: Teaching Certificate in Higher Education from the Derek Bok Center for Teaching and Learning at Harvard University (https://bokcenter.harvard.edu/) (October 2018-January 2019). Teaching experience: I served as a graduate teaching assistant for the following courses at the University of Crete (Greece): “Biochemistry and Microbiology”, Department of Biology, Spring 2008 “Biochemistry and Microbiology”, Department of Biology, Winter 2008
